metadata.Title: CVE-2022-35737 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: SQLite 1.0.12 through 3.39.x before 3.39.2 sometimes allows an array-bounds overflow if billions of bytes are used in a string argument to a C API.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> the wrong commit was previously identified, but didn't match the vulnerability PoC.

criterions.comment: sqlite: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
sqlite3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
